p: The Mediterranean Basin is an area representing only 1.6% of the Earth’s surface but is one of the world’s foremost centers for plant variety. Approximately 10% of the world’s higher plants can be found in this area [ 1]. It is home to a tremendous diversity of Mediterranean plants which are a rich source of phytochemicals and bioactive molecules important to human health. Aromatic plants play an important role in the discovery and development of new drugs, cosmetics and natural food supplements [ 2].
